person.note: Chen(1) Xiang(3) [7005] His ancestors migrated from Guangzhou, Gushi xian to Fuzhou, Houguan xian. Houguan xian residents Zhou(1) Ximeng [3242], Chen(1) Xiang(3) [7005], Zheng(1) Mu [7187], and Chen(1) Lie [3076] were called the 'Four Teachers' (si xiansheng) and were extremely close. Xiang(3) was buried in Changzhou, Yixing xian. Fu(5) Ji's[7225] and Fang(1) Meng's [7220] father-in-law, Zheng(1) Mu's [7187] and Liu(2) Yi(1)'s [1201] brother-in-law (his sisters' husbands). Xu(3) Chang's [742] friend. Several grandsons moved to Suzhou, Changshu xian from Changzhou, Yixing xian. His descendant Zun [7131] married a daughter of Li(2) Heng [7276] and moved to Suzhou, Kunshan xian. Chen(1) Bozhen [3078], an eighth generation descendant of the branch of the family that remained in Fujian and lived in Fuzhou, Changlo xian, was Guangdong yunfu in 1225. Chen Xiang, WJ, 'shou', 'fu,' 1a, 10b, 14a; Qinchuan zhi, 8.23a. Guangdong TZ, 16.11a. CBD, 3, 2518.
